replies.body: Well we have URF this weekend. Wonder if they will be happy or complain that is Random URF.
Oh, they'll complain. Just give it a bit.
I second this notion. _Of course_ they'll complain.
Guess I was being to hopeful huh?
I actually think ARURF is best. You get all the fun of URF without having to play against or with the same combos over and over and over. And it's super awesome when you land a sweet champion.
And then someone dodges and u get a sub-par champ next queue.
rammus 7 games in a row is not fun

Is it just the weekend? 

The patch notes say it's going to run the entire duration from 11th to 24th.

I don't mind either ways but can someone clear it up for me please.

Considering it says..and I quote: 

> All Random Ultra Rapid Fire (ARURF) is back from 8/11/17 12:00 PT to 8/24/17 11:59PM PT (Yes, the entire duration!)

I believe it is the entire duration.

> This one is long coming, but we're happy to say the "enemy vision here ping" is finally here! 

This has been long awaited and is much appreciated.

Now I just have to remember to bind it.
lmao same xD

{{champion:134}} I remember months and months ago, as a Syndra main, saying when they were first testing Syndra changes that the Q nerfs (and then Q passive changes) would lead to more and more focus on her ult. At the same time, I predicted that this indirect R buff would lead to R nerfs, and that Riot would continue backing themselves into a corner on this issue until she's nothing more than another burst champ/veigar wannabe. At which point she'll be reworked because a champion centered around nothing but a point-click R isn't much fun to play as or against and that niche is already filled anyway.

Looks like we're right on schedule.

Syndra is looking less and less like the champion people originally fell in love with. Riot has done nothing to this champion but continue to nerf the parts of this champion that actually made her fun for the sake of preserving what is probably the least-loved aspect of the champion.

Spamming Q and throwing damage in every direction and manipulating that was what made her kit unique. Her R is not only the most gameplay-toxic part of her kit, it's also the least interesting part to use! Spamming Q and the trade-centric gameplay that makes is fun. Repositioning spheres with W to be threatening from multiple angles is fun. The positioning game between players that E creates is fun. And not only is it fun for the Syndra, all of these are full of counterplay and can be fun for her opponents, too.

Counting spheres and point-clicking? Not very interesting. Not very engaging. Is it a necessary tool on her kit? In our world of assassin/mobility creep, sure, that reliable burst plays an important role. But is the ult the part of her kit that makes her fun? No.

So why are we focusing her kit more and more onto the part with the least counterplay? Why are we focusing her kit more and more onto the part that's the least fun, both playing with and against it? The only answer I can come up with is that Riot doesn't understand this champion at even the most basic of levels. That no one on the gameplay team plays this champion, and no one bothered to even try to ask anyone that does play her what actually makes her a fun and unique champion.

At least Syndra continues to maintain viability as an intolerable lane bully and isn't hard countered by a single mid-tier item.

Boo hoo, she lost .1 on her Q's ratio and **gained** .1 on E. The world is certainly crumbling down on you.

Meanwhile, Malzahar mains have had to put up with Riot's BS "balancing" patch after patch after patch. Literally nothing but nerfs for a dozen straight patches, both small and massive, until at long last, he received a compensation buff alongside a nerf. Was shocking to be sure. Now that more people have realized they can buy QSS and shut him out from playing the game, he's not viable anymore and Riot rejoiced.

No matter what, Syndra, one of Riot's rare AP golden children, must remain strong and viable at all times.
I sense the presence of salt in this comment...

Honestly im fine with them reverting her to her season 5 form if it means lb gets the same treatment. Remember in season 5 when no one complained about them? no buffs or nerfs? Just completely peaceful?

Every 2 weeks I come to see what the new rotating mode will be, and every 2 weeks I'm horribly horribly disappoi---

Wait, is that an URF mode? Oh hell yeah! lol
Yeah that Fizz change is suuuuppppeeerrrr fair, thanks Riot. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
What I read from the patch notes "Fizz isn't 100% pick/ban in the LCS. We want to rectify this, so we're giving him some unnecessary extra power." I'm exaggerating but you get it.
No exaggeration there, I'm pretty sure that's the exact quote from the patch notes.
Visiting the comments for my daily salt intake
Your doctor did warn you about minimizing your sodium intake on this page didn't they?

Whelp, there goes Riot nerfing a champion with an already abysmal win rate in solo queue again because she's played too often in LCS. Poor Taliyah. She already has a 47.72% win rate according to OP.GG. That's one heck of a huge nerf too.

I wish Riot wouldn't base their buffs and nerfs off of LCS and organized play so much.
They specifically stated this patch is FOR WORLDS.
Did it say that? I ignored it and instead read into it my own bias and fears in regards to myself being ridiculously adverse to change. You know, normal things.

No {{champion:31}} nerf? Did anyone see SKT vs KT Rolster? Game 1. Huni 1 shot Pawn's 2000 health Taliyah with just an R. His full-tank chogath did the most damage in the entire game, and ended up being banned for the rest of the series. I think there's something wrong when a full tank does the most dmg

ARURF is so much better than URF imo. It allows everyone to (for the most part) experience a greater range of champions, finding hidden fun picks and strong picks at the same time. It also means that when you do find a generally 'Over-Powered' pick, it means more than if you had been spamming them every game.

Personally I never spam "OP" picks. Because that's boring af. I always tried new shit, but at least I got to play MY champion. This is one of the reason I've been enjoying HotS lately(lol), because I ALWAYS get to play my champion. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
Getting a champion I wanted to try out of 130~ was fun for me...

"Oh no! If only Riot thought of this and had SOME sort of game mode where I could get to play my champ! Oh woe is me, alas, I shall go play a different game and flaunt it here in the Rito forums." -miniZergling

*thinks to myself* "Huh, I wonder why this guy doesn't just play blind pick so that he can play his champion every game..." *shrug*

We should be able to trade skin shards. I'll trade my DJ Sona shard for a Spirit Guard Udyr.
Also, can this years Victorious Skin be for Viktor? It would be....Viktorious.
Still no new skin for warwick or yorick. And no star guardian urgot

> no star guardian urgot

Literally unplayable.
Does anyone else think riot should update the cursor? Its always been that same cartoony gauntlet since forever ago, and it's just kind of out of place now IMO .
Ever since Riot started killing off our memes, the old cursor meme is one of the few that we have left.

If i spend my last reroll in arurf and i get {{champion:157}} what should i do? go to lane and die to all the op champs? or sit in spawn afk?
Arurf is just as Unbalanced as Normal Urf and Rito should really stop making modes random like ARSR, what kind of Sad excuse for a mode was that!? you could literally make the exact same mode in Custom games anytime you want!
The reason why i liked playing Urf was to play different champs and test wacky builds with them, but now i have to depend on luck that im able to try something at least once, basically in Arurf which ever team gets the more op champs will usually win while the other team has to suffer with champs that arent as good, Some champs were banned for a reason ya know. and worst of all you decide to give us anything close to urf when School is about to start again.
normal urf is worse because everyone spams op champions and that ain't fun

Honestly the fun of URF for me was getting to try out a champ I like to play normally, in URF. Some champs are just not fun. I'd rather get to pick my poison against the OP champs. Applying the 5 bans to URF would help as well I think. Still, it is not fun at all when I get a champ I don't like and who is quite weak in the mode, and get shat on by someone who randomly got an OP champ.

Did you forget the ban system exist? u cant ban in Arurf meaning the champs that no one wants to play against are still Available and they are going to show up every other game and you'll have to face them with a champ that you dont enjoy as much.
All bow down to Battle Boss {{champion:90}} !

Riot, please nerf the gold coin's gold generation. You should really take a look at the numbers comparison for the second tier version in comparison to Frost Queen's and Targons. It's insanity how much gold the gold coin offers for doing next to nothing. Mana, while a problem, was not the main issue with the item and the reason why most supports are now using it. Gold Coin forces you to be near minions, doing nothing, while the opposing items force you to fight for your gold. How do you not see this as a problem?

The thing about the coin is that it highlights a completely different dynamic to laning than the obvious farming and harass that the other two items focus on. The coin focuses on positioning, that can be just as important and often not considered in low tier play. Going in for a coin on say thresh or another champ with little mobility can really cost you if the enemy is pushing wave, or you can use it to bait out the enemy's spells and counter engage.

Just because people don't think about it as much in lower tiers, doesn't mean it's any easier than the other two quests.
Given how you max shield last on orianna and max w second, those ori nerfs don't seem so bad at first but are actually pretty substantial when you think about it.

{{champion:98}} 's Q bug has been known for weeks now but is not listed in the bugfixes. Is anyone working on it or is {{champion:98}} just going to have to deal with his Q going on cooldown but not giving him anything if he's standing on his Spirit Blade?
Cass's update summary is wrong.  Her E was changed, not Q.

I actually have a question though, why does it take so much effort to install the patch sometimes? It freezes and doesn't even start loading or finishes loading and won't switch over to the client even after waiting 10 minutes, and I have to try over and over again to install the patch. I'm sure others are having this issue, just thought I'd try to make riot aware of this problem. I even have the hextech repair tool and that doesn't seem to help. I'm running everything on windows 10 just in case that's relevant.

Are you going through wi-fi or ethernet cable? 

I guess either way there could be connection errors every now and then.
Inb4 someone tells me to reset my router lul

So I am to believe that Hero's Entrance is available to quickly but Lux with her 30 second cannon isn't a bit hasty? Urgots 70 second virtually unstoppable execute that ignores shield isn't just up a little too often?

Urgot's ult is a skill shot that doesn't do very much damage itself, and can be interrupted by killing him as he channels. Where as someone like Syndra has a single target ult that is unavoidable unless stasised and deals tons of damage. But why bother when she can 100-0 someone with just her Q-E-W combo?

Is nobody talking about Cho? {{champion:31}} That trash can literally flash R and 1 shot any squishy in game while being the tankiest champ in a given game. Unreal man, banrate has skyrocketed and rito can't put 2+2 together and realize that stupid champ needs a NERF.
